body_html:
Duplicate of #9465

Solution is what @ngimel proposed, i.e. use CUDA 9.0 binaries.
Alternatively, you can compile PyTorch from source with CUDA 9.2, using CuDNN 7.2 (recently released) that fixed this bug.

PyTorch binaries for the next release will link against CuDNN 7.2 (or whatever is the latest then).

body:
Duplicate of https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/issues/9465

Solution is what @ngimel proposed, i.e. use CUDA 9.0 binaries.
Alternatively, you can compile PyTorch from source with CUDA 9.2, using CuDNN 7.2 (recently released) that fixed this bug.

PyTorch binaries for the next release will link against CuDNN 7.2 (or whatever is the latest then).
